title: What are the some useful websites for studying? - Quora

response.answer_text: 50 INSANELY USEFUL WEBSITES for COLLEGE STUDENTS ACADEMIC 1. http://ureddit.com - free courses on tons of subjects 2. edX - free courses from top universities 3. YouTube to MP3 Converter - Convert YouTube Videos to MP3, MP4 - converts video to mp3 4. Computational Knowledge Engine - answers to HW questions 5. Quizlet - generates study tools 6. XMind: The Most Popular Mind Mapping Software on The Planet. - mind mapping tool 7. Build Cheat Sheets and Share Your Favourites! - cheat sheet builder 8. StudyBlue - generates learning tools 9. Audiobooks & Original Audio - audio version of books 10. instaGrok.com - interactive concept maps 11. BibMe: Free Bibliography & Citation Maker - bibliography and citation creator12. TalkTyper - Speech Recognition in a Browser - speech to text dictation 13. Pocket - stores articles for later viewing 14. Plagiarism checking tool - the most accurate and absolutely FREE! Try now! - checks essays for plagiarism 15. RateMyProfessors.com – Find and rate your professor or campus. - reviews of professors 16. College Matching and School Reviews. Your Guide to College - college & scholarship matcher 17. http://roomsurf.com - roommate matcher 18. http://koofers.com - reviews of courses & professors PRODUCTIVITY 19. http://habitica.com - game that improves good habits 20. http://todoist.com - task manager 21. http://lastpass.com - password vault 22. http://onedrive.tive.com - access files from all devices 23. http://thegrizzlylabs.com - portable scanner 24. http://icecreamapps.com - free software applications 25. http://slack.com - goup project communication tool 26. http://groupme.com - free group messaging 27. http://tomato-timer.com - productivity timer 28. http://keepmeout.com - blocks distracting websites 29. http://selfcontrolapps.com - blacklists distracting sites BUDGETING 30. http://studentrate.com - student deals and discounts 31. http://amazon.com - free 2 day shipping for students 32. http://freecycle.org - find and give away things for free 33. http://nightlifetonight.com - local nightlife deals 34. http://mint.com - finance manager 35. http://venmo.com - send money instantly 36. http://digit.co - slowly adds money to your savings 37. http://moneysavingexpert.com - financial advice 38. http://wisebread.com - tips for living on a budget HEALTH 39. http://eve.glovving.com - health & sex app for women 40. sleepytIme - wake up time calculator 41. http://delightrom.com - the best alarm ever 42. http://hookedapp.com - local deals on food & drink43. http://myfridgefood.com - recipe generator 44. http://buyagift.co.uk/content/foodhealth - what to eat 45. http://myfitnesspal.com - calorie & fitness tracker 46. http://sworkit.com - personalized video workouts OTHER 47. http://ucampus.net - discover your campus' city 48. http://instructables.com - how-to guides 49. http://unplugthetv.com - an alternative to TV binges 50. http://theskimm.com - daily email with the latest news

In this digital world, students spend maximum time on mobiles, laptops or computers. The time spent by them must not go wasted and must be utilized in an efficient way. Whatever the information they come through websites, those must be useful for students’ development. And here are some of the best websites for students to learn and gain knowledge: 1.Edx Edx is a massive open online course provider created by Harvard and MIT. It hosts online university-level courses in a wide range of disciplines to a worldwide student body, including some courses at no charge. 2. Coursera Coursera is a world-wide online learning platform that offers massive open online courses, specializations, and degrees. Coursera works with universities and other organizations to offer online courses, specializations, and degrees in a variety of subjects, such as engineering, data science, machine learning, mathematics, business, computer science, digital marketing, humanities, medicine, biology, social sciences, and others. 3. Grammarly Grammarly is an American multinational technology company that develops a digital writing tool using artificial intelligence and natural language processing. Through machine learning and deep learning algorithms, Grammarly’s product offers grammar checking, spell checking, and plagiarism detection services along with suggestions about writing clarity, concision, vocabulary, delivery style, and tone. 4. CareerGuide CareerGuide brings to you scientific and meticulously designed Psychometric Career Assessments and helps the students identify their interests and guide them towards bright career opportunities. The organization exercises cutting edge methodologies in designing the career roadmap of the students. 5. LifeHacker Lifehacker is a weblog about life hacks and software which covers a wide range of topics including Microsoft Windows, Mac, Linux programs, iOS, and Android, as well as general life tips and tricks. There are many more websites that provide enormous information and knowledge which helps in students’ development.  Image Source: Google Team Learnweel.
